intro: Armeria elongata var. chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean thrift, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of linear, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It is adapted to coastal and rocky environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
